record.description: [In 1932, the University of Chicago received a gift of 135 Messages Français from donors M. Edouard Champion, a well-known Parisian publisher, and MM. Manuel, an art photographer in Paris. Manuel and Champion had been gathering a large collection of photographs representing a broad range of French political, literary, diplomatic and artistic personalities of the time. These images were framed and placed on exhibition in Wiebolt Hall, in the French House, the Department of Art, and the International House.]
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Signature illegible. Info on the "messages francais" from University Record, July 1932, p. 178. Back has remnants of cardboard and glue.
